messages.message:
How do we get Google OCR to detect language? Is that also the same flags:
https://dogfood.instabase.com/apps/ocr/review-doc/carnalim/hsbc-poc/fs/Instabase%20Drive/files/round_2/data-google/out/s1_process_files/CPP_Sample.tif.ibocr?i=0&ibflowresults=#
@Jonathan Shih could you help take a look into this after your code pusyh
@Matt so i think you can use {“languages”: [“en”, “fr”]} for example
so you just want to put in all the languages you want to support into that list
So that works with google ocr? Not just Abby
nvm, i was mistaken. i don’t think it’s supported for google
google does automatic language detection :slightly_smiling_face: no need to do anything… theoretically

@dlluncor has made me aware that there are additional implications of the languages flag other than just passing it through to the ocr engine. @Matt google will automatically do language detection, but in order to render it in the write language on our side, you still need to specify a language flag. as long as you specify “languages” in the ocr options, it will work, so “languages”: [“en”, “zh-Hans”] will work. “languages”: [“en”] will also work
Will play around with it we have multi lingual docs so will see how it handles it
What’s your username I’ll add you to the repo
am i not in it already? i modified the flow that generated the file you linked so that it’ll work
